segment.source: How to Create an Application Group
segment.target: How to Create an Application Group

segment.source: How to Create an Application Group
segment.target: How to Create an Application Group

segment.source: How to Create an Application Group
segment.target: How to Create an Application Group

segment.source: In the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, you can use the following procedure to create application groups to organize your applications.
segment.target: In the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, you can use the following procedure to create application groups to organize your applications.

segment.source: In the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, click the Applications node in the left pane or expand it and highlight an existing application group.
segment.target: In the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, click the Applications node in the left pane or expand it and highlight an existing application group.

segment.source: Right-click the Applications node or the existing application group where you want to put the new group, and choose New Application Group.
segment.target: Right-click the Applications node or the existing application group where you want to put the new group, and choose New Application Group.

segment.source: In the New Application Group Wizard, type the name for the group and click OK.
segment.target: In the New Application Group Wizard, type the name for the group and click OK.

segment.source: Now you can populate the new group by importing applications.
segment.target: Now you can populate the new group by importing applications.

segment.source: You can also move applications between groups.
segment.target: You can also move applications between groups.

segment.source: For more information about moving applications, see How to Move an Application.
segment.target: For more information about moving applications, see How to Move an Application.
